trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> objects in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection> class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> objects in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection> class as the underlying data type of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelMenuItemStyles%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSelectedStyles%2A> properties.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelMenuItemStyles%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSelectedStyles%2A> properties are an alternative to the individual style properties (such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.StaticMenuItemStyle%2A>).
These properties are applied to regular menu items and the selected menu item, respectively, based on the menu item's level in the menu.
The first style in the collection corresponds to the menu item style for the first level of the menu.
The second style in the collection corresponds to the menu item style for the second level of the menu, and so on.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelMenuItemStyles%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSelectedStyles%2A> properties are most often used to generate menus where menu items at a certain level have the same appearance, regardless of whether they have submenus.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection> class inherits most of its members from the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection> class.
For more information on the inherited members, see <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection>.
Appends the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> object to the end of the current collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection.Add%2A> method to append the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object to the end of the collection.

As an alternative, you can insert a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object into the collection at a specific index by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection.Insert%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> to append to the end of the current collection.
The zero-based index of the added <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref>.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> object is in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection.Contains%2A> method to determine whether a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object is contained in the collection.

This method is commonly used to test for the existence of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object before performing a task, such as adding or removing a menu item style from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> to find.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> is contained in the collection; otherwise, `false`.

Copies all the items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection"></xref> object to a compatible one-dimensional array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> objects, starting at the specified index in the target array.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection> object into the specified zero-based array of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> objects.
Items are copied starting at the specified index of the target array.
You can then use the array to access the items in the collection.

A zero-based array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> objects that received the copied items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection"></xref>.
The position in the target array at which to start receiving the copied content.
Determines the index of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> object in the collection.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the zero-based index of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object in the collection.
If the node is not in the collection, the method returns -1.
If the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object appears multiple times in the collection, the index of the first occurrence is returned.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> to locate.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref>, if found; otherwise, -1.
Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> object into the collection at the specified index location.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection.Insert%2A> method to insert the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object into the collection at the specified zero-based index.

As an alternative, you can append a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object to the end of the collection using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection.Add%2A> method.
The zero-based index location at which to insert the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> to insert.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> object at the specified index from the collection.
Use this indexer to access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object from the collection at the specified index using array notation.
The indexer allows you to access, modify, or replace a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object in the collection directly.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> object from the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object from the collection.
All items that follow that menu item style are then moved up to fill the vacant position.
The indexes of the moved items are also updated.
As an alternative, you can remove a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object at a specific index by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> to remove.
Removes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> object at the specified index location from the collection.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method to remove the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object at the specified zero-based index location from the collection.
All items that follow that node are then moved up to fill the vacant position.
The indexes of the moved items are also updated.
As an alternative, you can remove a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection.Remove%2A> method.
The zero-based index location of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> to remove.
